GeoLightViz

GeoLightViz is an R package that provides an interactive Shiny application for visualizing and analyzing light-level geolocator data. The app helps researchers explore the complete workflow from raw light measurements to geographic positions.

Features

  • ğŸ” Side-by-side twilightâ€“map visualization: Instantly see how sunrise/sunset times translate to geographic positions
  • âœï¸ Interactive labeling: Interactively discard twilight points and watch position estimates update in real time
  • ğŸ“ Stationary period explorer: Define periods where the bird can be assumed at the same location and estimate likely locations
  • ğŸ¯ Real-time position updates: Change the position on the map to preview expected twilight patterns for any location
  • ğŸ“Š Calibration comparison: Visualize error distributions to assess the calibration assumptions and its impact on known locations
  • ğŸ—ºï¸ Likelihood exploration: Explore probability surfaces and position uncertainty
  • ğŸ’¾ Workflow support: Export labeled data for integration with GeoPressureRâ€™s advanced modeling tools
  • âš¡ Learn by doing: The intuitive interface makes twilight geolocation methods transparent and accessible

Installation

You can install the development version of GeoLightViz with:

# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("Rafnuss/GeoLightViz")

Quick Start

The package includes example data from a European Bee-eater tagged in Germany. Try it out:

# Get example data path
extdata_dir <- system.file("extdata", package = "GeoLightViz")

# Load and launch
tag <- tag_create(
  "14OI",
  directory = file.path(extdata_dir, "data/raw-tag/14OI"),
  crop_start = "2015-08-09",
  crop_end = "2016-07-11",
  assert_pressure = FALSE
)

geolightviz(tag)

Thatâ€™s it! The app will open in your browser where you can:

ğŸ“– For a detailed step-by-step tutorial with examples, see See the complete workflow in the tutorial â†’
